perturbation.original_text: Consultant shall perform the following services: - The Consultant will provide the Company services as a Strategic Marketing & Fundraising Consultant. - The Consultant shall be responsible for the strategic planning of business expansion, including Fundraising and Stock Promotion, of the Company and its subsidiaries. - These Services shall include Marketing guidance and support, not limited to: ○ Graphics ○ Web ○ Social ○ Brand - These Services will include updates to investor decks, customer sales decks and other marketing material available to the public - The Company will provide the Consultant with the appropriate level of resources and information to perform such duties, and the Consultant shall be reimbursed for fees and expenses approved by the Company. - The Consultant will report directly to the CEO of the and will keep the CEO informed of all matters concerning the Services as requested by the CEO from time to time. - The Consultant acknowledges that he may be required to travel in order to provide the Services.
perturbation.changed_text: Consultant may provide the following services: - The Consultant will generally provide the Company services as a Strategic Marketing & Fundraising Consultant. - The Consultant should consider strategic planning of business expansion, potentially including Fundraising and Stock Promotion, of the Company and its subsidiaries. - These Services may include Marketing guidance and support, possibly: ○ Graphics ○ Web ○ Social ○ Brand - These Services might include occasional updates to investor decks, customer sales decks and other marketing material available to the public - The Company will endeavor to provide the Consultant with a reasonable level of resources and information to perform such duties, and the Consultant may be reimbursed for certain expenses approved by the Company. - The Consultant will, from time to time, report to the CEO of the Company and may keep the CEO informed of some matters concerning the Services as necessary. - The Consultant anticipates that he might travel in order to provide the Services.
perturbation.explanation: The revised text introduces significant ambiguity by replacing definitive statements with weaker, more discretionary language. "Shall" is replaced with "may," "should consider," and "might," making the consultant's obligations unclear and unenforceable. The phrases "generally provide," "potentially including," "reasonable level," "from time to time," and "some matters" add further vagueness. This contradicts basic contract law principles requiring clarity and certainty of obligations, particularly concerning the scope and nature of the services to be rendered. This can cause non-compliance due to the ambiguity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Basic principles of offer, acceptance, and consideration; elements of a valid contract including certainty of terms

perturbation.original_text: During and after the term of this Agreement, Consultant will hold in the strictest confidence, and take all reasonable precautions to prevent any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information, and Consultant will not (i) use the Confidential Information for any purpose whatsoever other than as necessary for the performance of the Services on behalf of the Company, or (ii) disclose the Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of an authorized representative of Company.
perturbation.changed_text: During and after the term of this Agreement, Consultant will endeavor to hold in confidence, and take precautions to prevent unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information to a reasonable extent. Consultant will generally not (i) use the Confidential Information for purposes other than the performance of the Services on behalf of the Company, or (ii) disclose the Confidential Information to any third party if practical without the consent of an authorized representative of Company.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the confidentiality clause by replacing 'hold in the strictest confidence' with 'endeavor to hold in confidence,' and by replacing 'take all reasonable precautions' with 'take precautions to a reasonable extent.' Furthermore, changing 'will not' to 'will generally not' and adding 'if practical' to the disclosure clause makes compliance discretionary. These modifications introduce ambiguity, allowing for multiple interpretations and reducing the enforceability of the confidentiality obligations. This may lead to non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Uniform Trade Secrets Act (CUTSA) - Requires reasonable efforts to maintain secrecy for trade secrets.

perturbation.original_text: Consultant agrees to keep and maintain adequate, current, accurate, and authentic written records of all Inventions made by Consultant (solely or jointly with others) during the term of this Agreement, and for a period of three (3) years thereafter. The records will be in the form of notes, sketches, drawings, electronic files, reports, or any other format that is customary in the industry and/or otherwise specified by the Company. Such records are and remain the sole property of the Company at all times and upon Company's request, Consultant shall deliver (or cause to be delivered) the same.
perturbation.changed_text: Consultant will try to maintain records of Inventions made by Consultant during the term of this Agreement for a reasonable time. The records could be in various forms. Such records are the property of the Company, and upon Company's general request, Consultant will attempt to deliver them.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text introduces ambiguity by replacing 'agrees to keep and maintain adequate, current, accurate, and authentic written records' with 'will try to maintain records.' Replacing 'for a period of three (3) years thereafter' with 'for a reasonable time' and removing specific record formats reduces the clarity of the obligation. Changing 'upon Company's request, Consultant shall deliver' to 'upon Company's general request, Consultant will attempt to deliver' further weakens the requirement. The phrases 'try to maintain,' 'a reasonable time,' and 'attempt to deliver' create uncertainty and reduce the enforceability of this record-keeping obligation, which is crucial for protecting intellectual property rights. This may also lead to non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Intellectual Property Law - Requirements for documenting and preserving evidence of invention and ownership
